attributes.PROJECT_FULL_TITLE: Internal hydrogen infrastructure in Germany [currently known as H2ercules West]
attributes.TECHNICAL_DESCR:
Cross-border and national infrastructure project connecting the Belgium hydrogen backbone with demand centers in Western and Southwestern Germany. The project aims to develop a 500 km dedicated hydrogen infrastructure composed of new and converted onshore pipelines.

Importing into Germany (from Belgium towards Cologne area): new 110 km from Eynatten (border crossing Belgium-Germany) to Porz. 

Transport within Germany (from West to North and to the South):

  • Repurposed 320 km from Porz to Werne and from Porz to Lampertheim.
  • New 70 km from Lampertheim to Karlsruhe.

The estimated capacity for the whole project is approx. 0.844 Mt/y.

This route allows imports to be transported through Belgium via the Belgian ports and terminals to Germany. Thus, there is a connection of the consumption center Rhenish Mining Area and the chemical industry in Cologne.

In a second step, it will be possible to connect the Ruhr region and the demand center Frankfurt/Ludwigshafen as well as Karlsruhe further south with hydrogen by 2030 when further new built and repurposed pipelines are completed. 

The Rhenish Mining area, the chemical industry in Cologne and the Ruhr area in western Germany and the demand center Frankfurt/Ludwigshafen are characterized by a lot of industry and thus offer numerous decarbonization opportunities for the use of hydrogen.
